channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Samsung will use drone deliveries for Galaxy products in Ireland
item.description: Some Samsung customers in Ireland will receive their orders through a courier that can take to the skies and reach them within a few minutes.

item.title: Lime is offering app-free scooter rentals and free reservations to tempt new riders
item.description: Lime is targeting new riders by offering an app-less experience that saves you the hassle of creating an account and setting up a payment method.

item.title: The Morning After: The verdict on the OnePlus 9 Pro
item.description: And the big absence of movie theaters this last year.

item.title: Netflix's animated film 'The Mitchells vs. The Machines' arrives April 30th
item.description: Netflix has announced that "The Mitchells vs. The Machines" animated film from Into the Spider-Verse's Lord & Miller will arrive on April 30th.

item.title: Smart's airless bike tires use NASA tech to defeat punctures
item.description: NASA-approved startup Smart is using the space agency's smart memory alloy tech in its Metl bike tires.

item.title: MyZone’s hybrid fitness tracker breaks free of the chest strap
item.description: MyZone has announced an upgraded heart-rate tracker that doesn’t have to wrap around your torso to track your workouts and activity. The MZ-Switch is apparently the first device in the world that monitors both PPG (photoplethysmography) and ECG (electrocardiography) readings for more accurate activity monitoring with less “blind spots”.

item.title: Tesla now accepts Bitcoin in the US
item.description: As it promised earlier this year, Tesla now accepts payment in Bitcoin, according to Tesla's website and a tweet from CEO Elon Musk.

item.title: 'Final Fantasy XI' reboot for mobile has been canceled
item.description: The Final Fantasy XI reboot that Square Enix was developing with Nexon, a South Korean-Japanese publisher focusing on online games for PC and mobile, has officially been canceled.

item.title: Facebook's Clubhouse competitor could be a Messenger Rooms feature
item.description: Facebook's Messenger Rooms could offer a Live Audio broadcast experience à la Clubhouse in the future.

item.title: Amazon's new Fire TV voice remote with app shortcuts will ship April 14th
item.description: This $30 remote for your Fire TV adds four buttons linking directly to apps like Netflix and Disney+.

item.title: 'Auto Chess' is coming to PS5 with haptic feedback
item.description: 'Auto Chess' is coming to the PS5 on March 30th, and soon it's adding a Training Camp to assist new players.

item.title: Facebook didn't do enough to stop election misinformation, report says
item.description: Facebook missed billions of opportunities to tamp down misinformation ahead of the 2020 presidential election, according to a new report from Avaaz.

item.title: Intel invests $20 billion in two Arizona factories, 7nm chips coming in 2023
item.description: Intel is pushing to make itself more of a chip fabricator with a $20 billion investment in two Arizona plants.

item.title: Movies Anywhere is now available on Samsung TVs
item.description: You can download the software on any Samsung smart TV released between 2017 and 2021.

item.title: NASA plans test flight for Ingenuity prototype helicopter over Mars
item.description: The agency announced it plans to test fly the 4-pound prototype helicopter no earlier than April 8th.

item.title: SXSW in VR just made me miss the real world even more
item.description: SXSW 2021 was surprisingly lonely in VR -- it just made me miss the real show even more.

item.title: 'Black Widow' will hit Disney+ and theaters on the same day
item.description: You'll need to pay $30 to watch the latest MCU movie at home starting on May 7th.

item.title: YouTube won't remove a livestream from outside the Boulder mass shooting
item.description: A man named Dean Schiller livestreamed more than three hours of the incident.

item.title: Daymak says it's making the world's fastest three-wheeled EV
item.description: It's crowdfunding the $149,000 Spiritus Ultimate.

item.title: Sega's adorable Astro City Mini arcade is coming to the US
item.description: If you've been patiently waiting for a chance to buy Sega's Astro City Mini, you'll have a small window of opportunity to grab one on March 26th.

item.title: Amazon recruits 'Rainbow Six Siege' developers for its new game studio
item.description: The Montreal studio is making an original online multiplayer game.

item.title: How to pre-order the OnePlus 9 and 9 Pro
item.description: OnePlus just announced the OnePlus 9 and OnePlus 9 Pro. Here's how to pre-order both of the Android smartphones.

item.title: OnePlus 9 Pro review: A case against duopolies
item.description: Conventional wisdom — and quite a bit of market data — tells us that when people start shopping for high-end smartphones, they’ll usually wind up with an iPhone or a Samsung Galaxy. With the new OnePlus 9 Pro, though, OnePlus makes a convincing argument for skipping the duopoly and trying something different. That’s because the company managed to build its best smartphone yet, one truly deserving of the flagship label. Its focus on speed, screen quality, and a renewed commitment to photography just might help the brand win over a new legion of fans. It’s just too bad OnePlus’s best phones these days aren’t the deals they used to be.

item.title: This app reads your work to you and improves productivity
item.description: Elocance helps you become an efficient multitasker so that you can listen to your work while completing other tasks.

item.title: OnePlus' first smartwatch promises a two-week battery and speedy charging
item.description: OnePlus is ready to fully unveil its first smartwatch, which costs $159. The most interesting feature is its charging speed, which promises to get you a full day's juice in 5 minutes.
